\\DirectoryServices(NTDS)\\LDAP Searches.Description: This metric indicates the average number of searches per second for the NTDS object. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

\\DirectoryServices(NTDS)\\LDAP Successf.Description: This metric indicates the number of LDAP successful binds per second for the NTDS object. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

\\DNS\\Total Query Received/sec.Description: This metric indicates the average number of queries received by DNS server in each second. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

\\DNS\\Total Response Sent/sec.Description: This metric indicates the average number of reponses sent by DNS server in each second. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

\\Memory\\% Committed Bytes In Use.Description: This metric indicates the ratio of Memory\Committed Bytes to the Memory\Commit Limit. Committed memory is the physical memory in use for which space has been reserved in the paging file should it need to be written to disk. The commit limit is determined by the size of the paging file. If the paging file is enlarged, the commit limit increases, and the ratio is reduced. This counter displays the current percentage value only; it is not an average. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

\\Process(dns)\\% Processor Time.Description: This metric indicates the percentage of elapsed time that all of dns process threads used the processor to execute instructions. An instruction is the basic unit of execution in a computer, a thread is the object that executes instructions, and a process is the object created when a program is run. Code executed to handle some hardware interrupts and trap conditions are included in this count. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

\\Process(lsass)\\% Processor Time.Description: This metric indicates the percentage of elapsed time that all of lsass process threads used the processor to execute instructions. An instruction is the basic unit of execution in a computer, a thread is the object that executes instructions, and a process is the object created when a program is run. Code executed to handle some hardware interrupts and trap conditions are included in this count. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

\\Processor(_Total)\\% Processor Time.Description: This metric indicates the percentage of elapsed time that the processor spends to execute a non-Idle thread. It is calculated by measuring the percentage of time that the processor spends executing the idle thread and then subtracting that value from 100%. (Each processor has an idle thread that consumes cycles when no other threads are ready to run). This counter is the primary indicator of processor activity, and displays the average percentage of busy time observed during the sample interval. It should be noted that the accounting calculation of whether the processor is idle is performed at an internal sampling interval of the system clock (10ms). On todays fast processors, % Processor Time can therefore underestimate the processor utilization as the processor may be spending a lot of time servicing threads between the system clock sampling interval. Workload based timer applications are one example  of applications  which are more likely to be measured inaccurately as timers are signaled just after the sample is taken. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

\\Security System-Wide Statistics\\Kerbe.Description: This metric indicates the number of times that clients use a ticket to authenticate to this computer per second. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

\\Security System-Wide Statistics\\NTLM.Description: This metric indicates the number of NTLM authentications processed per second for the Active Directory on this domain contrller or for local accounts on this member server. It is backed by performance counter data from the domain controller, and can be filtered or splitted by role instance.

This metric reports 0 most of the time because geo-replication uses partial resynchronizations for any new data added after the initial full synchronization. GeoReplicationFullSyncEventStarted.Description: Fired on initiation of a full synchronization event between geo-replicated caches. This metric reports 0 most of the time because geo-replication uses partial resynchronizations for any new data added after the initial full synchronization. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/georeplicationmetrics.

ByteHitRatio.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D
ByteHitRatio.Description: This is the ratio of the total bytes served from the cache compared to the total response bytes

OriginHealthPercentage.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D
OriginHealthPercentage.Description: The percentage of successful health probes from AFDX to backends.

OriginLatency.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D
OriginLatency.Description: The time calculated from when the request was sent by AFDX edge to the backend until AFDX received the last response byte from the backend.

OriginRequestCount.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D
OriginRequestCount.Description: The number of requests sent from AFDX to origin.

Percentage4XX.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D
Percentage4XX.Description: The percentage of all the client requests for which the response status code is 4XX

Percentage5XX.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D
Percentage5XX.Description: The percentage of all the client requests for which the response status code is 5XX

RequestCount.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D
RequestCount.Description: The number of client requests served by the HTTP/S proxy

RequestSize.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D

ResponseSize.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D
ResponseSize.Description: The number of bytes sent as responses from HTTP/S proxy to clients

TotalLatency.Time Grains: PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H, P1D
TotalLatency.Description: The time calculated from when the client request was received by the HTTP/S proxy until the client acknowledged the last response byte from the HTTP/S proxy

Disk Read Bytes/Sec.Description: Average bytes read from disk during monitoring period.

Disk Write Bytes/Sec.Description: Average bytes written to disk during monitoring period.

Network In.Description: The number of bytes received on all network interfaces by the Virtual Machine(s) (Incoming Traffic).

Network Out.Description: The number of bytes out on all network interfaces by the Virtual Machine(s) (Outgoing Traffic).

Percentage CPU.Description: The percentage of allocated compute units that are currently in use by the Virtual Machine(s).

Disk Read Bytes/Sec.Description: Average bytes read from disk during monitoring period.

Disk Write Bytes/Sec.Description: Average bytes written to disk during monitoring period.

Network In.Description: The number of bytes received on all network interfaces by the Virtual Machine(s) (Incoming Traffic).

Network Out.Description: The number of bytes out on all network interfaces by the Virtual Machine(s) (Outgoing Traffic).

Percentage CPU.Description: The percentage of allocated compute units that are currently in use by the Virtual Machine(s).

Availability.Description: The percentage of availability for the storage service or the specified API operation. Availability is calculated by taking the TotalBillableRequests value and dividing it by the number of applicable requests, including those that produced unexpected errors. All unexpected errors result in reduced availability for the storage service or the specified API operation.

BlobCapacity.Description: The amount of storage used by the storage account's Blob service in bytes.

BlobCount.Description: The number of Blob in the storage account's Blob service.

ContainerCount.Description: The number of containers in the storage account's Blob service.

Egress.Description: The amount of egress data, in bytes. This number includes egress from an external client into Azure Storage as well as egress within Azure. As a result, this number does not reflect billable egress.

IndexCapacity.Description: The amount of storage used by ADLS Gen2 (Hierarchical) Index in bytes.

Ingress.Description: The amount of ingress data, in bytes. This number includes ingress from an external client into Azure Storage as well as ingress within Azure.

SuccessE2ELatency.Description: The end-to-end latency of successful requests made to a storage service or the specified API operation, in milliseconds. This value includes the required processing time within Azure Storage to read the request, send the response, and receive acknowledgment of the response.

SuccessServerLatency.Description: The latency used by Azure Storage to process a successful request, in milliseconds. This value does not include the network latency specified in SuccessE2ELatency.

Transactions.Description: The number of requests made to a storage service or the specified API operation. This number includes successful and failed requests, as well as requests which produced errors. Use ResponseType dimension for the number of different type of response.

Availability.Description: The percentage of availability for the storage service or the specified API operation. Availability is calculated by taking the TotalBillableRequests value and dividing it by the number of applicable requests, including those that produced unexpected errors. All unexpected errors result in reduced availability for the storage service or the specified API operation.

Egress.Description: The amount of egress data, in bytes. This number includes egress from an external client into Azure Storage as well as egress within Azure. As a result, this number does not reflect billable egress.

FileCapacity.Description: The amount of storage used by the storage account's File service in bytes.

FileCount.Description: The number of file in the storage account's File service.

FileShareCount.Description: The number of file shares in the storage account's File service.

FileShareQuota.Description: The upper limit on the amount of storage that can be used by Azure Files Service in bytes.

FileShareSnapshotCount.Description: The number of snapshots present on the share in storage account's Files Service.

FileShareSnapshotSize.Description: The amount of storage used by the snapshots in storage account's File service in bytes.

Ingress.Description: The amount of ingress data, in bytes. This number includes ingress from an external client into Azure Storage as well as ingress within Azure.

SuccessE2ELatency.Description: The end-to-end latency of successful requests made to a storage service or the specified API operation, in milliseconds. This value includes the required processing time within Azure Storage to read the request, send the response, and receive acknowledgment of the response.

SuccessServerLatency.Description: The latency used by Azure Storage to process a successful request, in milliseconds. This value does not include the network latency specified in SuccessE2ELatency.

Transactions.Description: The number of requests made to a storage service or the specified API operation. This number includes successful and failed requests, as well as requests which produced errors. Use ResponseType dimension for the number of different type of response.

Availability.Description: The percentage of availability for the storage service or the specified API operation. Availability is calculated by taking the TotalBillableRequests value and dividing it by the number of applicable requests, including those that produced unexpected errors. All unexpected errors result in reduced availability for the storage service or the specified API operation.

If a message is routed to multiple endpoints, this value increases by one for each successful delivery. If a message is delivered to the same endpoint multiple times, this value increases by one for each successful delivery.

RoutingDataSizeInBytesDelivered.Description: The total size in bytes of messages delivered by IoT hub to an endpoint. You can use the EndpointName and EndpointType dimensions to view the size of the messages in bytes delivered to your different endpoints. The metric value increases for every message delivered, including if the message is delivered to multiple endpoints or if the message is delivered to the same endpoint multiple times.

RoutingDeliveries.Description: The number of times IoT Hub attempted to deliver messages to all endpoints using routing. To see the number of successful or failed attempts, use the Result dimension. To see the reason of failure, like invalid, dropped, or orphaned, use the FailureReasonCategory dimension. You can also use the EndpointName and EndpointType dimensions to understand how many messages were delivered to your different endpoints. The metric value increases by one for each delivery attempt, including if the message is delivered to multiple endpoints or if the message is delivered to the same endpoint multiple times.

RoutingDeliveryLatency.Description: The average latency (milliseconds) between message ingress to IoT Hub and telemetry message ingress into an endpoint. You can use the EndpointName and EndpointType dimensions to understand the latency to your different endpoints.

ApiRequestsFailureRate.Description: The percentage of API requests that the service receives for your instance that return an internal error (500) response code for Digital Twins read, write, delete and query operations.

ApiRequestsLatency.Dimensions: Operation, Authentication, Protocol, StatusCode, StatusCodeClass, StatusText
ApiRequestsLatency.Description: The response time for API requests, i.e. from when the request is received by Azure Digital Twins until the service sends a success/fail result for Digital Twins read, write, delete and query operations.

BillingApiOperations.Description: Billing metric for the count of all API requests made against the Azure Digital Twins service.

DataHistoryRoutingLatency.Description: Time elapsed between an event getting routed from Azure Digital Twins to when it is posted to a time series database.

ImportJobEntityCount.Description: The number of twins, models, or relationships processed by an import job.

ImportJobLatency.Description: Total time taken for an import job to complete.

IngressEvents.Description: The number of incoming telemetry events into Azure Digital Twins.

IngressEventsFailureRate.Description: The percentage of incoming telemetry events for which the service returns an internal error (500) response code.

IngressEventsLatency.Description: The time from when an event arrives to when it is ready to be egressed by Azure Digital Twins, at which point the service sends a success/fail result.

ModelCount.Description: Total number of models in the Azure Digital Twins instance. Use this metric to determine if you are approaching the service limit for max number of models allowed per instance.

Routing.Description: The number of messages routed to an endpoint Azure service such as Event Hub, Service Bus or Event Grid.

AvailableStorage.Description: "Available Storage"will be removed from Azure Monitor at the end of September 2023. Cosmos DB collection storage size is now unlimited. The only restriction is that the storage size for each logical partition key is 20GB. You can enable PartitionKeyStatistics in Diagnostic Log to know the storage consumption for top partition keys. For more info about Cosmos DB storage quota, please check this doc https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/cosmos-db/concepts-limits. After deprecation, the remaining alert rules still defined on the deprecated metric will be automatically disabled post the deprecation date.

dependencies/failed.Dimensions: dependency/type, dependency/performanceBucket, dependency/success, dependency/target, dependency/resultCode, operation/synthetic, cloud/roleInstance, cloud/roleName
dependencies/failed.Description: Count of failed dependency calls made by the application to external resources.

exceptions/browser.Description: Count of uncaught exceptions thrown in the browser.

exceptions/count.Description: Combined count of all uncaught exceptions.

exceptions/server.Description: Count of uncaught exceptions thrown in the server application.

performanceCounters/exceptionsPerSecond.Description: Count of handled and unhandled exceptions reported to windows, including .NET exceptions and unmanaged exceptions that are converted into .NET exceptions.

performanceCounters/memoryAvailableBytes.Description: Physical memory immediately available for allocation to a process or for system use.

performanceCounters/processCpuPercentage.Description: The percentage of elapsed time that all process threads used the processor to execute instructions. This can vary between 0 to 100. This metric indicates the performance of w3wp process alone.

performanceCounters/processIOBytesPerSec.Description: Total bytes per second read and written to files, network and devices.

performanceCounters/processorCpuPercenta.Description: The percentage of time that the processor spends in non-idle threads.

performanceCounters/processPrivateBytes.Description: Memory exclusively assigned to the monitored application's processes.

performanceCounters/requestExecutionTime.Description: Execution time of the most recent request.

performanceCounters/requestsInQueue.Description: Length of the application request queue.

performanceCounters/requestsPerSecond.Description: Rate of all requests to the application per second from ASP.NET.

requests/count.Dimensions: request/performanceBucket, request/resultCode, operation/synthetic, cloud/roleInstance, request/success, cloud/roleName

requests/duration.Dimensions: request/performanceBucket, request/resultCode, operation/synthetic, cloud/roleInstance, request/success, cloud/roleName
requests/duration.Description: Time between receiving an HTTP request and finishing sending the response.

requests/failed.Dimensions: request/performanceBucket, request/resultCode, request/success, operation/synthetic, cloud/roleInstance, cloud/roleName
requests/failed.Description: Count of HTTP requests marked as failed. In most cases these are requests with a response code >= 400 and not equal to 401.

requests/rate.Dimensions: request/performanceBucket, request/resultCode, operation/synthetic, cloud/roleInstance, request/success, cloud/roleName
requests/rate.Description: Rate of server requests per second

ServiceApiHit.Description: Number of total service api hits

ServiceApiLatency.Description: Overall latency of service api requests

ServiceApiHit.Description: Number of total service api hits

ServiceApiLatency.Description: Overall latency of service api requests

ServiceApiResult.Description: Number of total service api results

capacity_cpu_cores.Description: Total number of cpu cores in a connected cluster

ConnectedNodebs.Description: Number of connected gNodeBs or eNodeBs

RegisteredSubscribersConnected.Description: Number of registered and connected subscribers

RegisteredSubscribersIdle.Description: Number of registered and idle subscribers

SessionEstablishmentAttempt.Description: PDU session establishment attempts rate (per minute)

SessionEstablishmentFailure.Description: PDU session establishment failure rate (per minute)

SessionEstablishmentSuccess.Description: PDU session establishment success rate (per minute)

UeContextReleaseCommand.Description: UE context release command message rate (per minute)

UeContextReleaseComplete.Description: UE context release complete message rate (per minute)

UeContextReleaseRequest.Description: UE context release request message rate (per minute)

BatchBlobCount.Description: Number of data sources in an aggregated batch for ingestion.

BatchDuration.Description: The duration of the aggregation phase in the ingestion flow.

BatchesProcessed.Description: Number of batches aggregated for ingestion. Batching Type: whether the batch reached batching time, data size or number of files limit set by batching policy

BatchSize.Description: Uncompressed expected data size in an aggregated batch for ingestion.

BlobsDropped.Description: Number of blobs permanently rejected by a component.

BlobsProcessed.Description: Number of blobs processed by a component.

BlobsReceived.Description: Number of blobs received from input stream by a component.

CacheUtilization.Description: Utilization level in the cluster scope. The metric is deprecated and presented for backward compatibility only, you should use the 'Cache utilization factor' metric instead.

CacheUtilizationFactor.Description: Percentage of utilized disk space dedicated for hot cache in the cluster. 100% means that the disk space assigned to hot data is optimally utilized. No action is needed in terms of the cache size. More than 100% means that the cluster's disk space is not large enough to accommodate the hot data, as defined by your caching policies. To ensure that sufficient space is available for all the hot data, the amount of hot data needs to be reduced or the cluster needs to be scaled out. Enabling auto scale is recommended.

ContinuousExportMaxLatenessMinutes.Description: The lateness (in minutes) reported by the continuous export jobs in the cluster

ContinuousExportNumOfRecordsExported.Description: Number of records exported, fired for every storage artifact written during the export operation

ContinuousExportPendingCount.Description: The number of pending continuous export jobs ready for execution

ContinuousExportResult.Description: Indicates whether Continuous Export succeeded or failed

DiscoveryLatency.Description: Reported by data connections (if exist). Time in seconds from when a message is enqueued or event is created until it is discovered by data connection. This time is not included in the Azure Data Explorer total ingestion duration.

EventsDropped.Description: Number of events dropped permanently by data connection. An Ingestion result metric with a failure reason will be sent.

EventsProcessed.Description: Number of events processed by the cluster

EventsProcessedForEventHubs.Description: Number of events processed by the cluster when ingesting from Event/IoT Hub

EventsReceived.Description: Number of events received by data connection.

FollowerLatency.Description: The follower databases synchronize changes in the leader databases. Because of the synchronization, there's a data lag of a few seconds to a few minutes in data availability.This metric measures the length of the time lag. The time lag depends on the overall size of the leader database metadata.This is a cluster level metrics: the followers catch metadata of all databases that are followed. This metric represents the latency of the process.

IngestionLatencyInSeconds.Description: Latency of data ingested, from the time the data was received in the cluster until it's ready for query. The ingestion latency period depends on the ingestion scenario.

IngestionResult.Description: Total number of sources that either failed or succeeded to be ingested. Splitting the metric by status, you can get detailed information about the status of the ingestion operations.

IngestionUtilization.Description: Ratio of used ingestion slots in the cluster

IngestionVolumeInMB.Description: Overall volume of ingested data to the cluster

KeepAlive.Description: Sanity check indicates the cluster responds to queries

MaterializedViewAgeMinutes.Description: The materialized view age in minutes

MaterializedViewAgeSeconds.Description: The materialized view age in seconds

MaterializedViewDataLoss.Description: Indicates potential data loss in materialized view

MaterializedViewHealth.Description: The health of the materialized view (1 for healthy, 0 for non-healthy)

MaterializedViewRecordsInDelta.Description: The number of records in the non-materialized part of the view

MaterializedViewResult.Description: The result of the materialization process

QueueLength.Description: Number of pending messages in a component's queue.

QueueOldestMessage.Description: Time in seconds from when the oldest message in queue was inserted.

ReceivedDataSizeBytes.Description: Size of data received by data connection. This is the size of the data stream, or of raw data size if provided.

StageLatency.Description: Cumulative time from when a message is discovered until it is received by the reporting component for processing (discovery time is set when message is enqueued for ingestion queue, or when discovered by data connection).

WeakConsistencyLatency.Description: The max latency between the previous metadata sync and the next one (in DB/node scope)

IntegrationServiceEnvironmentConnectorMe.Description: Connector memory usage for integration service environment.

IntegrationServiceEnvironmentConnectorPr.Description: Connector processor usage for integration service environment.

IntegrationServiceEnvironmentWorkflowMem.Description: Workflow memory usage for integration service environment.

IntegrationServiceEnvironmentWorkflowPro.Description: Workflow processor usage for integration service environment.

ActionThrottledEvents.Description: Number of workflow action throttled events..

BillableActionExecutions.Description: Number of workflow action executions getting billed.

BillableTriggerExecutions.Description: Number of workflow trigger executions getting billed.

BillingUsageNativeOperation.Description: Number of native operation executions getting billed.

BillingUsageStandardConnector.Description: Number of standard connector executions getting billed.

BillingUsageStorageConsumption.Description: Number of storage consumption executions getting billed.

RunStartThrottledEvents.Description: Number of workflow run start throttled events.

RunThrottledEvents.Description: Number of workflow action or trigger throttled events.

TotalBillableExecutions.Description: Number of workflow executions getting billed.

TriggerThrottledEvents.Description: Number of workflow trigger throttled events.

Active Nodes.Description: Number of Acitve nodes. These are the nodes which are actively running a job.

Cancel Requested Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Cancel Requested Runs.Description: Number of runs where cancel was requested for this workspace. Count is updated when cancellation request has been received for a run.

Cancelled Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Cancelled Runs.Description: Number of runs cancelled for this workspace. Count is updated when a run is successfully cancelled.

Completed Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Completed Runs.Description: Number of runs completed successfully for this workspace. Count is updated when a run has completed and output has been collected.

CpuCapacityMillicores.Description: Maximum capacity of a CPU node in millicores. Capacity is aggregated in one minute intervals.

CpuMemoryCapacityMegabytes.Description: Maximum memory utilization of a CPU node in megabytes. Utilization is aggregated in one minute intervals.

CpuMemoryUtilizationMegabytes.Description: Memory utilization of a CPU node in megabytes. Utilization is aggregated in one minute intervals.

CpuMemoryUtilizationPercentage.Description: Memory utilization percentage of a CPU node. Utilization is aggregated in one minute intervals.

CpuUtilization.Description: Percentage of utilization on a CPU node. Utilization is reported at one minute intervals.

CpuUtilizationMillicores.Description: Utilization of a CPU node in millicores. Utilization is aggregated in one minute intervals.

CpuUtilizationPercentage.Description: Utilization percentage of a CPU node. Utilization is aggregated in one minute intervals.

DiskAvailMegabytes.Description: Available disk space in megabytes. Metrics are aggregated in one minute intervals.

DiskReadMegabytes.Description: Data read from disk in megabytes. Metrics are aggregated in one minute intervals.

DiskUsedMegabytes.Description: Used disk space in megabytes. Metrics are aggregated in one minute intervals.

DiskWriteMegabytes.Description: Data written into disk in megabytes. Metrics are aggregated in one minute intervals.

Errors.Description: Number of run errors in this workspace. Count is updated whenever run encounters an error.

Failed Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Failed Runs.Description: Number of runs failed for this workspace. Count is updated when a run fails.

Finalizing Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Finalizing Runs.Description: Number of runs entered finalizing state for this workspace. Count is updated when a run has completed but output collection still in progress.

GpuCapacityMilliGPUs.Description: Maximum capacity of a GPU device in milli-GPUs. Capacity is aggregated in one minute intervals.

GpuEnergyJoules.Dimensions: Scenario, runId, rootRunId, InstanceId, DeviceId, ComputeName
GpuEnergyJoules.Description: Interval energy in Joules on a GPU node. Energy is reported at one minute intervals.

GpuMemoryCapacityMegabytes.Description: Maximum memory capacity of a GPU device in megabytes. Capacity aggregated in at one minute intervals.

GpuMemoryUtilization.Description: Percentage of memory utilization on a GPU node. Utilization is reported at one minute intervals.

GpuMemoryUtilizationMegabytes.Description: Memory utilization of a GPU device in megabytes. Utilization aggregated in at one minute intervals.

GpuMemoryUtilizationPercentage.Description: Memory utilization percentage of a GPU device. Utilization aggregated in at one minute intervals.

GpuUtilization.Description: Percentage of utilization on a GPU node. Utilization is reported at one minute intervals.

GpuUtilizationMilliGPUs.Description: Utilization of a GPU device in milli-GPUs. Utilization is aggregated in one minute intervals.

GpuUtilizationPercentage.Description: Utilization percentage of a GPU device. Utilization is aggregated in one minute intervals.

IBReceiveMegabytes.Description: Network data received over InfiniBand in megabytes. Metrics are aggregated in one minute intervals.

IBTransmitMegabytes.Description: Network data sent over InfiniBand in megabytes. Metrics are aggregated in one minute intervals.

Idle Nodes.Description: Number of idle nodes. Idle nodes are the nodes which are not running any jobs but can accept new job if available.

Leaving Nodes.Description: Number of leaving nodes. Leaving nodes are the nodes which just finished processing a job and will go to Idle state.

Model Deploy Failed.Description: Number of model deployments that failed in this workspace

Model Deploy Started.Description: Number of model deployments started in this workspace

Model Deploy Succeeded.Description: Number of model deployments that succeeded in this workspace

Model Register Failed.Description: Number of model registrations that failed in this workspace

Model Register Succeeded.Description: Number of model registrations that succeeded in this workspace

NetworkInputMegabytes.Description: Network data received in megabytes. Metrics are aggregated in one minute intervals.

NetworkOutputMegabytes.Description: Network data sent in megabytes. Metrics are aggregated in one minute intervals.

Not Responding Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Not Responding Runs.Description: Number of runs not responding for this workspace. Count is updated when a run enters Not Responding state.

Not Started Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Not Started Runs.Description: Number of runs in Not Started state for this workspace. Count is updated when a request is received to create a run but run information has not yet been populated.

Preempted Nodes.Description: Number of preempted nodes. These nodes are the low priority nodes which are taken away from the available node pool.

Preparing Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Preparing Runs.Description: Number of runs that are preparing for this workspace. Count is updated when a run enters Preparing state while the run environment is being prepared.

Provisioning Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Provisioning Runs.Description: Number of runs that are provisioning for this workspace. Count is updated when a run is waiting on compute target creation or provisioning.

Queued Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Queued Runs.Description: Number of runs that are queued for this workspace. Count is updated when a run is queued in compute target. Can occure when waiting for required compute nodes to be ready.

Started Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Started Runs.Description: Number of runs running for this workspace. Count is updated when run starts running on required resources.

Starting Runs.Dimensions: Scenario, RunType, PublishedPipelineId, ComputeType, PipelineStepType, ExperimentName
Starting Runs.Description: Number of runs started for this workspace. Count is updated after request to create run and run info, such as the Run Id, has been populated

StorageAPIFailureCount.Description: Azure Blob Storage API calls failure count.

StorageAPISuccessCount.Description: Azure Blob Storage API calls success count.

Total Nodes.Description: Number of total nodes. This total includes some of Active Nodes, Idle Nodes, Unusable Nodes, Premepted Nodes, Leaving Nodes

Unusable Nodes.Description: Number of unusable nodes. Unusable nodes are not functional due to some unresolvable issue. Azure will recycle these nodes.

Warnings.Description: Number of run warnings in this workspace. Count is updated whenever a run encounters a warning.

CpuMemoryUtilizationPercentage.Description: Percentage of memory utilization on an instance. Utilization is reported at one minute intervals.

CpuUtilizationPercentage.Description: Percentage of CPU utilization on an instance. Utilization is reported at one minute intervals.

DataCollectionErrorsPerMinute.Description: The number of data collection events dropped per minute.

DataCollectionEventsPerMinute.Description: The number of data collection events processed per minute.

DeploymentCapacity.Description: The number of instances in the deployment.

DiskUtilization.Description: Percentage of disk utilization on an instance. Utilization is reported at one minute intervals.

GpuEnergyJoules.Description: Interval energy in Joules on a GPU node. Energy is reported at one minute intervals.

GpuMemoryUtilizationPercentage.Description: Percentage of GPU memory utilization on an instance. Utilization is reported at one minute intervals.

GpuUtilizationPercentage.Description: Percentage of GPU utilization on an instance. Utilization is reported at one minute intervals.

RequestLatency_P50.Description: The average P50 request latency aggregated by all request latency values collected over the selected time period

RequestLatency_P90.Description: The average P90 request latency aggregated by all request latency values collected over the selected time period

RequestLatency_P95.Description: The average P95 request latency aggregated by all request latency values collected over the selected time period

RequestLatency_P99.Description: The average P99 request latency aggregated by all request latency values collected over the selected time period

RequestsPerMinute.Description: The number of requests sent to online deployment within a minute

ConnectionsActive.Description: The total number of concurrent TCP connections active from clients.

DataCollectionErrorsPerMinute.Description: The number of data collection events dropped per minute.

DataCollectionEventsPerMinute.Description: The number of data collection events processed per minute.

NetworkBytes.Description: The bytes per second served for the endpoint.

NewConnectionsPerSecond.Description: The average number of new TCP connections per second established from clients.

RequestLatency.Description: The average complete interval of time taken for a request to be responded in milliseconds

RequestLatency_P50.Description: The average P50 request latency aggregated by all request latency values collected over the selected time period

RequestLatency_P90.Description: The average P90 request latency aggregated by all request latency values collected over the selected time period

RequestLatency_P95.Description: The average P95 request latency aggregated by all request latency values collected over the selected time period

RequestLatency_P99.Description: The average P99 request latency aggregated by all request latency values collected over the selected time period

RequestsPerMinute.Description: The number of requests sent to online endpoint within a minute

OutboundConnectionsFail.Description: Count of outbound total failed connections

IfSubIfInBroadcastPkts.Description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer.

IfSubIfInDiscards.Description: The number of inbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

IfSubIfInErrors.Description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

IfSubIfInFcsErrors.Description: Number of received packets which had errors in the frame check sequence (FCS), i.e., framing errors.

IfSubIfInMulticastPkts.Description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer. For a MAC-layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

IfSubIfInOctets.Description: The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

IfSubIfInPkts.Description: The total number of packets received on the interface, including all unicast, multicast, broadcast and bad packets etc.

IfSubIfInUnicastPkts.Description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer.

IfSubIfInUnknownProtos.Description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of packets received via the interface that were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

IfSubIfOutBroadcastPkts.Description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and that were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

IfSubIfOutDiscards.Description: The number of outbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted.

IfSubIfOutErrors.Description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

IfSubIfOutMulticastPkts.Description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and that were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. For a MAC-layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

IfSubIfOutOctets.Description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

IfSubIfOutPkts.Description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface, including all unicast, multicast, broadcast, and bad packets etc.

IfSubIfOutUnicastPkts.Description: The total number of packets that higher-level requested be transmitted, and that were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

IntNwInBitsRate.Description: Calculated received bits rate of the interface.

IntNwInBroadcastPkts.Description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer.

IntNwInDiscards.Description: The number of inbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

IntNwInErrors.Description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

IntNwInMulticastPkts.Description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer. For a MAC-layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

IntNwInOctets.Description: The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

IntNwInPktsRate.Description: The rate of packets received on the interface, including all unicast, multicast, broadcast and bad packets etc.

IntNwInUcastPkts.Description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer.

IntNwOutBitsRate.Description: Calculated transmitted bits rate of the interface.

IntNwOutBroadcastPkts.Description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and that were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

IntNwOutDiscards.Description: The number of outbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted.

IntNwOutErrors.Description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

IntNwOutMulticastPkts.Description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and that were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. For a MAC-layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

IntNwOutOctets.Description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

IntNwOutPktsRate.Description: The rate of packets transmitted out of the interface, including all unicast, multicast, broadcast, and bad packets etc.

IntNwOutUcastPkts.Description: The total number of packets that higher-level requested be transmitted, and that were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

AclMatchedPackets.Description: Count of the number of packets matching the current ACL entry.

BgpPeerStatus.Description: Operational state of the BGP peer. State is represented in numerical form. Idle : 1, Connect : 2, Active : 3, Opensent : 4, Openconfirm : 5, Established : 6

ComponentOperStatus.Description: The current operational status of the component.

CpuUtilizationMax.Description: Max cpu utilization. The maximum value of the percentage measure of the statistic over the time interval.

CpuUtilizationMin.Description: Min cpu utilization. The minimum value of the percentage measure of the statistic over the time interval.

IfEthInCrcErrors.Description: The total number of frames received that had a length (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) of between 64 and 1518 octets, inclusive, but had either a bad Frame Check Sequence (FCS) with an integral number of octets (FCS Error) or a bad FCS with a non-integral number of octets (Alignment Error)

IfEthInFragmentFrames.Description: The total number of frames received that were less than 64 octets in length (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets) and had either a bad Frame Check Sequence (FCS) with an integral number of octets (FCS Error) or a bad FCS with a non-integral number of octets (Alignment Error).

IfEthInJabberFrames.Description: Number of jabber frames received on the interface. Jabber frames are typically defined as oversize frames which also have a bad CRC.

IfEthInMacControlFrames.Description: MAC layer control frames received on the interface

IfEthInMacPauseFrames.Description: MAC layer PAUSE frames received on the interface

IfEthInMaxsizeExceeded.Description: The total number frames received that are well-formed dropped due to exceeding the maximum frame size on the interface.

IfEthInOversizeFrames.Description: The total number of frames received that were longer than 1518 octets (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) and were otherwise well formed.

IfEthOutMacControlFrames.Description: MAC layer control frames sent on the interface.

IfEthOutMacPauseFrames.Description: MAC layer PAUSE frames sent on the interface.

IfInBroadcastPkts.Description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer.

IfInDiscards.Description: The number of inbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

IfInErrors.Description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

IfInFcsErrors.Description: Number of received packets which had errors in the frame check sequence (FCS), i.e., framing errors.

IfInMulticastPkts.Description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer. For a MAC-layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

IfInOctets.Description: The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

IfInPkts.Description: The total number of packets received on the interface, including all unicast, multicast, broadcast and bad packets etc.

IfInUnicastPkts.Description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer.

IfOutBroadcastPkts.Description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and that were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

IfOutDiscards.Description: The number of outbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted.

IfOutErrors.Description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

IfOutMulticastPkts.Description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and that were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. For a MAC-layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

IfOutOctets.Description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

IfOutPkts.Description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface, including all unicast, multicast, broadcast, and bad packets etc.

IfOutUnicastPkts.Description: The total number of packets that higher-level requested be transmitted, and that were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

InterfaceOperStatus.Description: The current operational state of the interface. State is represented in numerical form. Up: 0, Down: 1, Lower_layer_down: 2, Testing: 3, Unknown: 4, Dormant: 5, Not_present: 6.

LacpErrors.Description: Number of LACPDU illegal packet errors.

LacpRxErrors.Description: Number of LACPDU receive packet errors.

LacpTxErrors.Description: Number of LACPDU transmit packet errors.

LacpUnknownErrors.Description: Number of LACPDU unknown packet errors.

LldpFrameIn.Description: The number of lldp frames received.

LldpFrameOut.Description: The number of frames transmitted out.

LldpTlvUnknown.Description: The number of frames received with unknown TLV.

MemoryAvailable.Description: The available memory physically installed, or logically allocated to the component.

MemoryUtilized.Description: The memory currently in use by processes running on the component, not considering reserved memory that is not available for use.

PowerSupplyCapacity.Description: Maximum power capacity of the power supply (watts).

PowerSupplyInputCurrent.Description: The input current draw of the power supply (amps).

PowerSupplyInputVoltage.Description: Input voltage to the power supply (volts).

PowerSupplyOutputCurrent.Description: The output current supplied by the power supply (amps)

PowerSupplyOutputPower.Description: Output power supplied by the power supply (watts)

PowerSupplyOutputVoltage.Description: Output voltage supplied by the power supply (volts).

TemperatureInstant.Description: The instantaneous value of temperature in degrees Celsius of the component.

TemperatureMax.Description: Max temperature in degrees Celsius of the component. The maximum value of the statistic over the sampling period.

IngestBitrate.Description: The incoming bitrate ingested for a live event, in bits per second.

IngestDriftValue.Description: Drift between the timestamp of the ingested content and the system clock, measured in seconds per minute. A non zero value indicates that the ingested content is arriving slower than system clock time.

IngestLastTimestamp.Description: Last timestamp ingested for a live event.

LiveOutputLastTimestamp.Description: Timestamp of the last fragment uploaded to storage for a live event output.

StreamingPolicyQuotaUsedPercentage.Description: Streaming Policy used percentage in current media service account

CPU.Description: CPU usage for premium streaming endpoints. This data is not available for standard streaming endpoints.

Egress.Description: The amount of Egress data, in bytes.

EgressBandwidth.Description: Egress bandwidth in bits per second.

SuccessE2ELatency.Description: The average latency for successful requests in milliseconds.

ApplicationGatewayTotalTime.Description: Time that it takes for a request to be processed and its response to be sent. This is the interval from the time when Application Gateway receives the first byte of an HTTP request to the time when the response send operation finishes. It's important to note that this usually includes the Application Gateway processing time, time that the request and response packets are traveling over the network and the time the backend server took to respond.

outgoing.apns.success.Description: The count of all successful notifications.

outgoing.gcm.authenticationerror.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the PNS did not accept the provided credentials the credentials are blocked or the SenderId is not correctly configured in the app (GCM result: MismatchedSenderId).

outgoing.gcm.badchannel.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the registrationId in the registration was not recognized (GCM result: Invalid Registration).

outgoing.gcm.expiredchannel.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the registrationId in the registration was expired (GCM result: NotRegistered).

outgoing.gcm.invalidcredentials.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the PNS did not accept the provided credentials or the credentials are blocked.

outgoing.gcm.invalidnotificationformat.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the payload was not formatted correctly (GCM result: InvalidDataKey or InvalidTtl).

outgoing.gcm.invalidnotificationsize.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the payload was too large (GCM result: MessageTooBig).

outgoing.gcm.pnserror.Description: The count of pushes that failed because of errors communicating with GCM.

outgoing.gcm.success.Description: The count of all successful notifications.

outgoing.gcm.throttled.Description: The count of pushes that failed because GCM throttled this app (GCM status code: 501-599 or result:Unavailable).

outgoing.gcm.wrongchannel.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the registrationId in the registration is not associated to the current app (GCM result: InvalidPackageName).

outgoing.mpns.authenticationerror.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the PNS did not accept the provided credentials or the credentials are blocked.

outgoing.mpns.badchannel.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the ChannelURI in the registration was not recognized (MPNS status: 404 not found).

outgoing.mpns.channeldisconnected.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the ChannelURI in the registration was disconnected (MPNS status: 412 not found).

outgoing.mpns.dropped.Description: The count of pushes that were dropped by MPNS (MPNS response header: X-NotificationStatus: QueueFull or Suppressed).

outgoing.mpns.invalidcredentials.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the PNS did not accept the provided credentials or the credentials are blocked.

outgoing.mpns.invalidnotificationformat.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the payload of the notification was too large.

outgoing.mpns.pnserror.Description: The count of pushes that failed because of errors communicating with MPNS.

outgoing.mpns.success.Description: The count of all successful notifications.

outgoing.mpns.throttled.Description: The count of pushes that failed because MPNS is throttling this app (WNS MPNS: 406 Not Acceptable).

outgoing.wns.authenticationerror.Description: Notification not delivered because of errors communicating with Windows Live invalid credentials or wrong token.

outgoing.wns.badchannel.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the ChannelURI in the registration was not recognized (WNS status: 404 not found).

outgoing.wns.channeldisconnected.Description: The notification was dropped because the ChannelURI in the registration is throttled (WNS response header: X-WNS-DeviceConnectionStatus: disconnected).

outgoing.wns.channelthrottled.Description: The notification was dropped because the ChannelURI in the registration is throttled (WNS response header: X-WNS-NotificationStatus:channelThrottled).

outgoing.wns.dropped.Description: The notification was dropped because the ChannelURI in the registration is throttled (X-WNS-NotificationStatus: dropped but not X-WNS-DeviceConnectionStatus: disconnected).

outgoing.wns.expiredchannel.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the ChannelURI is expired (WNS status: 410 Gone).

outgoing.wns.invalidcredentials.Description: The count of pushes that failed because the PNS did not accept the provided credentials or the credentials are blocked. (Windows Live does not recognize the credentials).

outgoing.wns.invalidnotificationformat.Description: The format of the notification is invalid (WNS status: 400). Note that WNS does not reject all invalid payloads.

outgoing.wns.invalidnotificationsize.Description: The notification payload is too large (WNS status: 413).

outgoing.wns.invalidtoken.Description: The token provided to WNS is not valid (WNS status: 401 Unauthorized).

outgoing.wns.pnserror.Description: Notification not delivered because of errors communicating with WNS.

outgoing.wns.success.Description: The count of all successful notifications.

outgoing.wns.throttled.Description: The count of pushes that failed because WNS is throttling this app (WNS status: 406 Not Acceptable).

outgoing.wns.wrongtoken.Description: The token provided to WNS is valid but for another application (WNS status: 403 Forbidden). This can happen if the ChannelURI in the registration is associated with another app. Check that the client app is associated with the same app whose credentials are in the notification hub.

tempdb_log_used_percent.Description: Space used percentage in tempdb transaction log file. Not applicable to data warehouses.

wlg_active_queries_timeouts.Description: Queries that have timed out for the workload group. Applies only to data warehouses.

wlg_allocation_relative_to_system_percen.Description: Allocated percentage of resources relative to the entire system per workload group. Applies only to data warehouses.

wlg_allocation_relative_to_wlg_effective.Description: Allocated percentage of resources relative to the specified cap resources per workload group. Applies only to data warehouses.

wlg_effective_cap_resource_percent.Description: A hard limit on the percentage of resources allowed for the workload group, taking into account Effective Min Resource Percentage allocated for other workload groups. Applies only to data warehouses.

wlg_effective_min_resource_percent.Description: Minimum percentage of resources reserved and isolated for the workload group, taking into account the service level minimum. Applies only to data warehouses.

wlg_queued_queries.Description: Queued queries within the workload group. Applies only to data warehouses.

workers_percent.Description: Workers percentage. Not applicable to data warehouses.

xtp_storage_percent.Description: In-Memory OLTP storage percent. Not applicable to data warehouses.

allocated_data_storage.Description: Data space allocated. Not applicable to hyperscale

allocated_data_storage_percent.Description: Data space allocated percent. Not applicable to hyperscale

app_cpu_billed.Description: App CPU billed. Applies to serverless elastic pools.

app_cpu_percent.Description: App CPU percentage. Applies to serverless elastic pools.

app_memory_percent.Description: App memory percentage. Applies to serverless elastic pools.

cpu_limit.Description: CPU limit. Applies to vCore-based elastic pools.

cpu_used.Description: CPU used. Applies to vCore-based elastic pools.

dtu_consumption_percent.Description: DTU Percentage. Applies to DTU-based elastic pools.

eDTU_limit.Description: eDTU limit. Applies to DTU-based elastic pools.

eDTU_used.Description: eDTU used. Applies to DTU-based elastic pools.

sql_instance_cpu_percent.Description: CPU usage by all user and system workloads. Applies to elastic pools.

sql_instance_memory_percent.Description: Memory usage by the database engine instance. Applies to elastic pools.

sqlserver_process_core_percent.Description: CPU usage as a percentage of the SQL DB process. Applies to elastic pools. (This metric is equivalent to sql_instance_cpu_percent, and will be removed in the future.)

sqlserver_process_memory_percent.Description: Memory usage as a percentage of the SQL DB process. Applies to elastic pools. (This metric is equivalent to sql_instance_memory_percent, and will be removed in the future.)

storage_limit.Description: Data max size. Not applicable to hyperscale

storage_percent.Description: Data space used percent. Not applicable to hyperscale

storage_used.Description: Data space used. Not applicable to hyperscale

tempdb_data_size.Description: Space used in tempdb data files in kilobytes.

tempdb_log_size.Description: Space used in tempdb transaction log file in kilobytes.

tempdb_log_used_percent.Description: Space used percentage in tempdb transaction log file

xtp_storage_percent.Description: In-Memory OLTP storage percent. Not applicable to hyperscale

elastic_jobs_failed.Description: Number of job executions that failed while trying to execute on target

elastic_jobs_successful.Description: Number of job executions that were able to successfully execute on target

elastic_jobs_timeout.Description: Number of job executions that expired before execution was able to finish on target.

Availability.Description: The percentage of availability for the storage service or the specified API operation. Availability is calculated by taking the TotalBillableRequests value and dividing it by the number of applicable requests, including those that produced unexpected errors. All unexpected errors result in reduced availability for the storage service or the specified API operation.

BlobCapacity.Description: The amount of storage used by the storage account's Blob service in bytes.

BlobCount.Description: The number of blob objects stored in the storage account.

BlobProvisionedSize.Description: The amount of storage provisioned in the storage account's Blob service in bytes.

ContainerCount.Description: The number of containers in the storage account.

Egress.Description: The amount of egress data. This number includes egress to external client from Azure Storage as well as egress within Azure. As a result, this number does not reflect billable egress.

IndexCapacity.Description: The amount of storage used by Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 hierarchical index.

Ingress.Description: The amount of ingress data, in bytes. This number includes ingress from an external client into Azure Storage as well as ingress within Azure.

SuccessE2ELatency.Description: The average end-to-end latency of successful requests made to a storage service or the specified API operation, in milliseconds. This value includes the required processing time within Azure Storage to read the request, send the response, and receive acknowledgment of the response.

SuccessServerLatency.Description: The average time used to process a successful request by Azure Storage. This value does not include the network latency specified in SuccessE2ELatency.

Transactions.Dimensions: ResponseType, GeoType, ApiName, Authentication, TransactionType, Tier
Transactions.Description: The number of requests made to a storage service or the specified API operation. This number includes successful and failed requests, as well as requests which produced errors. Use ResponseType dimension for the number of different type of response.

FileCapacity.Description: The amount of File storage used by the storage account.

FileCount.Description: The number of files in the storage account.

FileShareCapacityQuota.Description: The upper limit on the amount of storage that can be used by Azure Files Service in bytes.

FileShareCount.Description: The number of file shares in the storage account.

FileShareMaxUsedBandwidthMiBps.Description: The maximum number of used bandwidth in MiB/s at the lowest time granularity of 1-minute for the premium file share in the premium files storage account.

FileShareMaxUsedIOPS.Description: The maximum number of used IOPS at the lowest time granularity of 1-minute for the premium file share in the premium files storage account.

FileShareProvisionedIOPS.Description: The baseline number of provisioned IOPS for the premium file share in the premium files storage account. This number is calculated based on the provisioned size (quota) of the share capacity.

FileShareSnapshotCount.Description: The number of snapshots present on the share in storage account's Files Service.

FileShareSnapshotSize.Description: The amount of storage used by the snapshots in storage account's File service in bytes.

Ingress.Description: The amount of ingress data, in bytes. This number includes ingress from an external client into Azure Storage as well as ingress within Azure.

SuccessServerLatency.Description: The average time used to process a successful request by Azure Storage. This value does not include the network latency specified in SuccessE2ELatency.

ClientReadOps.Description: Number of client read ops performed.

ClientWriteOps.Description: Number of client write ops performed.

MDTBytesAvailable.Description: Number of bytes marked as available on the MDT.

MDTBytesTotal.Description: Total number of bytes supported on the MDT.

MDTBytesUsed.Description: Number of bytes available for use minus the number of bytes marked as free on the MDT.

MDTClientLatency.Description: Client latency for all operations to MDTs.

MDTClientOps.Description: Number of client MDT metadata ops performed.

MDTConnectedClients.Description: Number of client connections (exports) to the MDT

MDTFilesFree.Description: Count of free files (inodes) on the MDT.

MDTFilesTotal.Description: Total number of files supported on the MDT.

MDTFilesUsed.Description: Number of total supported files minus the number of free files on the MDT.

OSTBytesAvailable.Description: Number of bytes marked as available on the OST.

OSTBytesTotal.Description: Total number of bytes supported on the OST.

OSTBytesUsed.Description: Number of bytes available for use minus the number of bytes marked as free on the OST.

OSTClientLatency.Description: Client latency for all operations to OSTs.

OSTClientOps.Description: Number of client OST metadata ops performed.

OSTConnectedClients.Description: Number of client connections (exports) to the OST

OSTFilesFree.Description: Count of free files (inodes) on the OST.

OSTFilesTotal.Description: Total number of files supported on the OST.

OSTFilesUsed.Description: Number of total supported files minus the number of free files on the OST.

ClientIOPS.Description: The rate of client file operations processed by the Cache.

ClientLatency.Description: Average latency of client file operations to the Cache.

ClientLockIOPS.Description: Client file locking operations per second.

ClientMetadataReadIOPS.Description: The rate of client file operations sent to the Cache, excluding data reads, that do not modify persistent state.

ClientMetadataWriteIOPS.Description: The rate of client file operations sent to the Cache, excluding data writes, that modify persistent state.

FileOps.Description: Number of file operations per second.

FileReads.Description: Number of bytes per second read from a file.

FileUpdates.Description: Number of directory updates and metadata operations per second.

FileWrites.Description: Number of bytes per second written to a file.

StorageTargetAccessErrors.Description: The rate of access error responses received by the cache from a specific StorageTarget. For more details, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc1813#section-2.6 (NFS3ERR_ACCES).

StorageTargetAsyncWriteThroughput.Description: The rate the Cache asynchronously writes data to a particular StorageTarget. These are opportunistic writes that do not cause clients to block.

StorageTargetBlocksRecycled.Description: Total number of 16k cache blocks recycled (freed) per Storage Target.

StorageTargetFileTooLargeErrors.Description: The rate of file too large error responses received by the cache from a specific StorageTarget. For more details, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc1813#section-2.6 (NFS3ERR_FBIG).

StorageTargetFillThroughput.Description: The rate the Cache reads data from the StorageTarget to handle a cache miss.

StorageTargetFlushFailureErrors.Description: The rate of file flush request failures reported by the writeback state machine for a specific StorageTarget.

StorageTargetFreeReadSpace.Description: Read space available for caching files associated with a storage target.

StorageTargetFreeWriteSpace.Description: Write space available for changed files associated with a storage target.

StorageTargetHealth.Description: Boolean results of connectivity test between the Cache and Storage Targets.

StorageTargetIOPS.Description: The rate of all file operations the Cache sends to a particular StorageTarget.

StorageTargetLatency.Description: The average round trip latency of all the file operations the Cache sends to a partricular StorageTarget.

StorageTargetMetadataReadIOPS.Description: The rate of file operations that do not modify persistent state, and excluding the read operation, that the Cache sends to a particular StorageTarget.

StorageTargetMetadataWriteIOPS.Description: The rate of file operations that do modify persistent state and excluding the write operation, that the Cache sends to a particular StorageTarget.

StorageTargetNoSpaceErrors.Description: The rate of no space available error responses received by the cache from a specific StorageTarget. For more details, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc1813#section-2.6 (NFS3ERR_NOSPC).

StorageTargetPermissionErrors.Description: The rate of permission error responses received by the cache from a specific StorageTarget. For more details, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc1813#section-2.6 (NFS3ERR_PERM).

StorageTargetQuotaLimitErrors.Description: The rate of quota limit error responses received by the cache from a specific StorageTarget. For more details, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc1813#section-2.6 (NFS3ERR_DQUOT).

StorageTargetReadAheadThroughput.Description: The rate the Cache opportunisticly reads data from the StorageTarget.

StorageTargetReadIOPS.Description: The rate of file read operations the Cache sends to a particular StorageTarget.

StorageTargetReadOnlyErrors.Description: The rate of read-only filesystem error responses received by the cache from a specific StorageTarget. For more details, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc1813#section-2.6 (NFS3ERR_ROFS).

StorageTargetRecycleRate.Description: Cache space recycle rate associated with a storage target in the HPC Cache. This is the rate at which existing data is cleared from the cache to make room for new data.

StorageTargetRequestTooSmallErrors.Description: The rate of request too small error responses received by the cache from a specific StorageTarget. For more details, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc1813#section-2.6 (NFS3ERR_TOOSMALL).

StorageTargetRetryableFlushErrors.Description: The rate of retryable file flush errors reported by the writeback state machine for a specific StorageTarget.

StorageTargetSpaceAllocation.Description: Total space (read and write) allocated for a storage target.

StorageTargetSyncWriteThroughput.Description: The rate the Cache synchronously writes data to a particular StorageTarget. These are writes that do cause clients to block.

StorageTargetTotalCacheOps.Description: The rate of operations the cache is servicing for the namespace represented by a specific StorageTarget.

StorageTargetTotalReadSpace.Description: Total read space allocated for caching files associated with a storage target.

StorageTargetTotalReadThroughput.Description: The total rate that the Cache reads data from a particular StorageTarget.

StorageTargetTotalWriteSpace.Description: Total write space allocated for changed files associated with a storage target.

StorageTargetTotalWriteThroughput.Description: The total rate that the Cache writes data to a particular StorageTarget.

StorageTargetUnrecoverableFlushErrors.Description: The rate of unrecoverable file flush errors reported by the writeback state machine for a specific StorageTarget.

StorageTargetUpdateFoundAsyncCacheOps.Description: The rate of file updates discovered by asynchronous verification operations sent by the cache to a specific StorageTarget.

StorageTargetUpdateFoundSyncCacheOps.Description: The rate of file updates discovered by synchronous verification operations sent by the cache to a specific StorageTarget.

StorageTargetUsedReadSpace.Description: Read space used by cached files associated with a storage target.

StorageTargetUsedWriteSpace.Description: Write space used by changed files associated with a storage target.

StorageTargetVerificationAsyncCacheOps.Description: The rate of asynchronous verification operations sent by the cache to a specific StorageTarget.

StorageTargetVerificationSyncCacheOps.Description: The rate of synchronous verification operations sent by the cache to a specific StorageTarget.

StorageTargetWriteIOPS.Description: The rate of the file write operations the Cache sends to a particular StorageTarget.

TotalBlocksRecycled.Description: Total number of 16k cache blocks recycled (freed) for the HPC Cache.

TotalFreeReadSpace.Description: Total space available for caching read files.

TotalFreeWriteSpace.Description: Total write space available to store changed data in the cache.

TotalRecycleRate.Description: Total cache space recycle rate in the HPC Cache. This is the rate at which existing data is cleared from the cache to make room for new data.

TotalUsedReadSpace.Description: Total read space used by changed files for the HPC Cache.

TotalUsedWriteSpace.Description: Total write space used by changed files for the HPC Cache.

Uptime.Description: Boolean results of connectivity test between the Cache and monitoring system.

JobRunScanThroughputItems.Description: Job Run scan throughput in items/sec

JobRunTransferThroughputBytes.Description: Job Run transfer throughput in bytes/sec

JobRunTransferThroughputItems.Description: Job Run transfer throughput in items/sec

ServerSyncSessionResult.Description: Metric that logs a value of 1 each time the Server Endpoint successfully completes a Sync Session with the Cloud Endpoint

StorageSyncBatchTransferredFileBytes.Description: Total file size transferred for Sync Sessions

StorageSyncComputedCacheHitRate.Description: Percentage of bytes that were served from the cache

StorageSyncDataSizeByAccessPattern.Description: Size of data by last access time

StorageSyncIncrementalTieredDataSizeByte.Description: Size of data tiered during last maintenance job

StorageSyncRecallComputedSuccessRate.Description: Percentage of all recalls that were successful

StorageSyncRecalledNetworkBytesByApplica.Description: Size of data recalled by application

StorageSyncServerHeartbeat.Description: Metric that logs a value of 1 each time the resigtered server successfully records a heartbeat with the Cloud Endpoint

StorageSyncSyncSessionPerItemErrorsCount.Description: Count of files failed to sync

StorageSyncTieredDataSizeBytes.Description: Size of data tiered to Azure file share

StorageSyncTieringCacheSizeBytes.Description: Size of data cached on the server
