BigDataPoolAllocatedCores.Description: Allocated vCores for an Apache Spark Pool

BigDataPoolAllocatedMemory.Description: Allocated Memory for Apach Spark Pool (GB)

BigDataPoolApplicationsActive.Description: Total Active Apache Spark Pool Applications

BigDataPoolApplicationsEnded.Description: Count of Apache Spark pool applications ended

BatchBlobCount.Description: Number of data sources in an aggregated batch for ingestion.

BatchDuration.Description: The duration of the aggregation phase in the ingestion flow.

BatchesProcessed.Description: Number of batches aggregated for ingestion. Batching Type: whether the batch reached batching time, data size or number of files limit set by batching policy

BatchSize.Description: Uncompressed expected data size in an aggregated batch for ingestion.

BlobsDropped.Description: Number of blobs permanently rejected by a component.

BlobsProcessed.Description: Number of blobs processed by a component.

BlobsReceived.Description: Number of blobs received from input stream by a component.

CacheUtilization.Description: Utilization level in the cluster scope. The metric is deprecated and presented for backward compatibility only, you should use the 'Cache utilization factor' metric instead.

CacheUtilizationFactor.Description: Percentage of utilized disk space dedicated for hot cache in the cluster. 100% means that the disk space assigned to hot data is optimally utilized. No action is needed in terms of the cache size. More than 100% means that the cluster's disk space is not large enough to accommodate the hot data, as defined by your caching policies. To ensure that sufficient space is available for all the hot data, the amount of hot data needs to be reduced or the cluster needs to be scaled out. Enabling auto scale is recommended.

ContinuousExportMaxLatenessMinutes.Description: The lateness (in minutes) reported by the continuous export jobs in the cluster

ContinuousExportNumOfRecordsExported.Description: Number of records exported, fired for every storage artifact written during the export operation

ContinuousExportPendingCount.Description: The number of pending continuous export jobs ready for execution

ContinuousExportResult.Description: Indicates whether Continuous Export succeeded or failed

DiscoveryLatency.Description: Reported by data connections (if exist). Time in seconds from when a message is enqueued or event is created until it is discovered by data connection. This time is not included in the Azure Data Explorer total ingestion duration.

EventsDropped.Description: Number of events dropped permanently by data connection. An Ingestion result metric with a failure reason will be sent.

EventsProcessed.Description: Number of events processed by the cluster

EventsProcessedForEventHubs.Description: Number of events processed by the cluster when ingesting from Event/IoT Hub

EventsReceived.Description: Number of events received by data connection.

FollowerLatency.Description: The follower databases synchronize changes in the leader databases. Because of the synchronization, there's a data lag of a few seconds to a few minutes in data availability.This metric measures the length of the time lag. The time lag depends on the overall size of the leader database metadata.This is a cluster level metrics: the followers catch metadata of all databases that are followed. This metric represents the latency of the process.

IngestionLatencyInSeconds.Description: Latency of data ingested, from the time the data was received in the cluster until it's ready for query. The ingestion latency period depends on the ingestion scenario.

IngestionResult.Description: Total number of sources that either failed or succeeded to be ingested. Splitting the metric by status, you can get detailed information about the status of the ingestion operations.

IngestionUtilization.Description: Ratio of used ingestion slots in the cluster

IngestionVolumeInMB.Description: Overall volume of ingested data to the cluster

KeepAlive.Description: Sanity check indicates the cluster responds to queries

MaterializedViewAgeMinutes.Description: The materialized view age in minutes

MaterializedViewAgeSeconds.Description: The materialized view age in seconds

MaterializedViewDataLoss.Description: Indicates potential data loss in materialized view

MaterializedViewHealth.Description: The health of the materialized view (1 for healthy, 0 for non-healthy)

MaterializedViewRecordsInDelta.Description: The number of records in the non-materialized part of the view

MaterializedViewResult.Description: The result of the materialization process

QueueLength.Description: Number of pending messages in a component's queue.

QueueOldestMessage.Description: Time in seconds from when the oldest message in queue was inserted.

ReceivedDataSizeBytes.Description: Size of data received by data connection. This is the size of the data stream, or of raw data size if provided.

StageLatency.Description: Cumulative time from when a message is discovered until it is received by the reporting component for processing (discovery time is set when message is enqueued for ingestion queue, or when discovered by data connection).

WeakConsistencyLatency.Description: The max latency between the previous metadata sync and the next one (in DB/node scope)

BuiltinSqlPoolDataProcessedBytes.Description: Amount of data processed by queries

BuiltinSqlPoolLoginAttempts.Description: Count of login attempts that succeded or failed

BuiltinSqlPoolRequestsEnded.Description: Count of Requests that succeeded, failed, or were cancelled

IntegrationActivityRunsEnded.Description: Count of integration activities that succeeded, failed, or were cancelled

IntegrationLinkConnectionEvents.Description: Number of Synapse Link connection events including start, stop and failure.

IntegrationLinkProcessedChangedRows.Description: Changed row count processed by Synapse Link.

IntegrationLinkProcessedDataVolume.Description: Data volume in bytes processed by Synapse Link.

IntegrationLinkProcessingLatencyInSecond.Description: Synapse Link data processing latency in seconds.

IntegrationLinkTableEvents.Description: Number of Synapse Link table events including snapshot, removal and failure.

IntegrationPipelineRunsEnded.Description: Count of integration pipeline runs that succeeded, failed, or were cancelled

IntegrationTriggerRunsEnded.Description: Count of integration triggers that succeeded, failed, or were cancelled

SQLStreamingBackloggedInputEventSources.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingBackloggedInputEventSources.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events sources backlogged.

SQLStreamingConversionErrors.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingConversionErrors.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of output events that could not be converted to the expected output schema. Error policy can be changed to 'Drop' to drop events that encounter this scenario.

SQLStreamingDeserializationError.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingDeserializationError.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events that could not be deserialized.

SQLStreamingEarlyInputEvents.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingEarlyInputEvents.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events which application time is considered early compared to arrival time, according to early arrival policy.

SQLStreamingInputEventBytes.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingInputEventBytes.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Amount of data received by the streaming job, in bytes. This can be used to validate that events are being sent to the input source.

SQLStreamingInputEvents.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingInputEvents.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events.

SQLStreamingInputEventsSourcesPerSecond.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingInputEventsSourcesPerSecond.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events sources per second.

SQLStreamingLateInputEvents.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingLateInputEvents.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events which application time is considered late compared to arrival time, according to late arrival policy.

SQLStreamingOutOfOrderEvents.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingOutOfOrderEvents.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of Event Hub Events (serialized messages) received by the Event Hub Input Adapter, received out of order that were either dropped or given an adjusted timestamp, based on the Event Ordering Policy.

SQLStreamingOutputEvents.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingOutputEvents.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of output events.

SQLStreamingOutputWatermarkDelaySeconds.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingOutputWatermarkDelaySeconds.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Output watermark delay in seconds.

SQLStreamingResourceUtilization.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingResourceUtilization.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Resource utilization expressed as a percentage. High utilization indicates that the job is using close to the maximum allocated resources.

SQLStreamingRuntimeErrors.Dimensions: SQLPoolName, SQLDatabaseName, JobName, LogicalName, PartitionId, ProcessorInstance
SQLStreamingRuntimeErrors.Description: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Total number of errors related to query processing (excluding errors found while ingesting events or outputting results).

ScopePoolJobPNMetric.Description: PN (process node) duration (Milliseconds) used by each SCOPE job

ScopePoolJobQueuedDurationMetric.Description: Queued duration (Milliseconds) used by each SCOPE job

ScopePoolJobRunningDurationMetric.Description: Running duration (Milliseconds) used by each SCOPE job

ActiveQueries.Description: The active queries. Using this metric unfiltered and unsplit displays all active queries running on the system

AdaptiveCacheHitPercent.Description: Measures how well workloads are utilizing the adaptive cache. Use this metric with the cache hit percentage metric to determine whether to scale for additional capacity or rerun workloads to hydrate the cache

AdaptiveCacheUsedPercent.Description: Measures how well workloads are utilizing the adaptive cache. Use this metric with the cache used percentage metric to determine whether to scale for additional capacity or rerun workloads to hydrate the cache

Connections.Description: Count of Total logins to the SQL pool

ConnectionsBlockedByFirewall.Description: Count of connections blocked by firewall rules. Revisit access control policies for your SQL pool and monitor these connections if the count is high

CPUPercent.Description: CPU utilization across all nodes in the SQL pool

DWULimit.Description: Service level objective of the SQL pool

DWUUsed.Description: Represents a high-level representation of usage across the SQL pool. Measured by DWU limit * DWU percentage

DWUUsedPercent.Description: Represents a high-level representation of usage across the SQL pool. Measured by taking the maximum between CPU percentage and Data IO percentage

LocalTempDBUsedPercent.Description: Local tempdb utilization across all compute nodes - values are emitted every five minute

MemoryUsedPercent.Description: Memory utilization across all nodes in the SQL pool

QueuedQueries.Description: Cumulative count of requests queued after the max concurrency limit was reached

WLGActiveQueries.Description: The active queries within the workload group. Using this metric unfiltered and unsplit displays all active queries running on the system

WLGActiveQueriesTimeouts.Description: Queries for the workload group that have timed out. Query timeouts reported by this metric are only once the query has started executing (it does not include wait time due to locking or resource waits)

WLGAllocationByEffectiveCapResourcePerce.Description: Displays the percentage allocation of resources relative to the Effective cap resource percent per workload group. This metric provides the effective utilization of the workload group

WLGAllocationBySystemPercent.Description: The percentage allocation of resources relative to the entire system

WLGEffectiveCapResourcePercent.Description: The effective cap resource percent for the workload group. If there are other workload groups with min_percentage_resource > 0, the effective_cap_percentage_resource is lowered proportionally

WLGEffectiveMinResourcePercent.Description: The effective min resource percentage setting allowed considering the service level and the workload group settings. The effective min_percentage_resource can be adjusted higher on lower service levels

WLGQueuedQueries.Description: Cumulative count of requests queued after the max concurrency limit was reached

IngressReceivedBytes.Description: Count of bytes read from the event source

IngressReceivedInvalidMessages.Description: Count of invalid messages read from the event source

IngressReceivedMessages.Description: Count of messages read from the event source

IngressReceivedMessagesCountLag.Description: Difference between the sequence number of last enqueued message in the event source partition and sequence number of messages being processed in Ingress

IngressReceivedMessagesTimeLag.Description: Difference between the time that the message is enqueued in the event source and the time it is processed in Ingress

IngressStoredBytes.Description: Total size of events successfully processed and available for query

IngressStoredEvents.Description: Count of flattened events successfully processed and available for query

WarmStorageMaxProperties.Description: Maximum number of properties used allowed by the environment for S1/S2 SKU and maximum number of properties allowed by Warm Store for PAYG SKU

WarmStorageUsedProperties.Description: Number of properties used by the environment for S1/S2 SKU and number of properties used by Warm Store for PAYG SKU

IngressReceivedInvalidMessages.Description: Count of invalid messages read from all Event hub or IoT hub event sources

IngressReceivedMessages.Description: Count of messages read from all Event hub or IoT hub event sources

IngressReceivedMessagesTimeLag.Description: Difference between the time that the message is enqueued in the event source and the time it is processed in Ingress

IngressStoredBytes.Description: Total size of events successfully processed and available for query

IngressStoredEvents.Description: Count of flattened events successfully processed and available for query

WarmStorageMaxProperties.Description: Maximum number of properties used allowed by the environment for S1/S2 SKU and maximum number of properties allowed by Warm Store for PAYG SKU

WarmStorageUsedProperties.Description: Number of properties used by the environment for S1/S2 SKU and number of properties used by Warm Store for PAYG SKU

RestartCount.Description: Restart count of container app replicas

WorkingSetBytes.Description: Container App working set memory used in bytes.

BytesSent.Description: Outgoing bandwidth used across all front end instances

Http5xx.Description: Number of requests resulting in an HTTP status code ≥ 500 but < 600

MediumAppServicePlanInstances.Description: Number of medium App Service Plan worker instances

SmallAppServicePlanInstances.Description: Number of small App Service Plan worker instances

AverageResponseTime.Description: The average time taken for the front end to serve requests, in seconds.

BytesReceived.Description: The average incoming bandwidth used across all front ends, in MiB.

BytesSent.Description: The average incoming bandwidth used across all front end, in MiB.

CpuPercentage.Description: The average CPU used across all instances of front end.

DiskQueueLength.Description: The average number of both read and write requests that were queued on storage. A high disk queue length is an indication of an app that might be slowing down because of excessive disk I/O.

Http101.Description: The count of requests resulting in an HTTP status code 101.

Http2xx.Description: The count of requests resulting in an HTTP status code ≥ 200 but < 300.

Http3xx.Description: The count of requests resulting in an HTTP status code ≥ 300 but < 400.

Http401.Description: The count of requests resulting in HTTP 401 status code.

Http403.Description: The count of requests resulting in HTTP 403 status code.

Http406.Description: The count of requests resulting in HTTP 406 status code.

Http4xx.Description: The count of requests resulting in an HTTP status code ≥ 400 but < 500.

Http5xx.Description: The count of requests resulting in an HTTP status code ≥ 500 but < 600.

HttpQueueLength.Description: The average number of HTTP requests that had to sit on the queue before being fulfilled. A high or increasing HTTP Queue length is a symptom of a plan under heavy load.

HttpResponseTime.Description: The time taken for the front end to serve requests, in seconds.

MemoryPercentage.Description: The average memory used across all instances of front end.

Requests.Description: The total number of requests regardless of their resulting HTTP status code.

CpuPercentage.Description: The average CPU used across all instances of the worker pool.

MemoryPercentage.Description: The average memory used across all instances of the worker pool.

BytesReceived.Description: The average incoming bandwidth used across all instances of the plan.

BytesSent.Description: The average outgoing bandwidth used across all instances of the plan.

CpuPercentage.Description: The average CPU used across all instances of the plan.

DiskQueueLength.Description: The average number of both read and write requests that were queued on storage. A high disk queue length is an indication of an app that might be slowing down because of excessive disk I/O.

HttpQueueLength.Description: The average number of HTTP requests that had to sit on the queue before being fulfilled. A high or increasing HTTP Queue length is a symptom of a plan under heavy load.

MemoryPercentage.Description: The average memory used across all instances of the plan.

SocketInboundAll.Description: The average number of sockets used for incoming HTTP requests across all the instances of the plan.

SocketLoopback.Description: The average number of sockets used for loopback connections across all the instances of the plan.

SocketOutboundAll.Description: The average number of sockets used for outbound connections across all the instances of the plan irrespective of their TCP states. Having too many outbound connections can cause connectivity errors.

SocketOutboundEstablished.Description: The average number of sockets in ESTABLISHED state used for outbound connections across all the instances of the plan.

SocketOutboundTimeWait.Description: The average number of sockets in TIME_WAIT state used for outbound connections across all the instances of the plan. High or increasing outbound socket counts in TIME_WAIT state can cause connectivity errors.

TcpCloseWait.Description: The average number of sockets in CLOSE_WAIT state across all the instances of the plan.

TcpClosing.Description: The average number of sockets in CLOSING state across all the instances of the plan.

TcpEstablished.Description: The average number of sockets in ESTABLISHED state across all the instances of the plan.

TcpFinWait1.Description: The average number of sockets in FIN_WAIT_1 state across all the instances of the plan.

TcpFinWait2.Description: The average number of sockets in FIN_WAIT_2 state across all the instances of the plan.

TcpLastAck.Description: The average number of sockets in LAST_ACK state across all the instances of the plan.

TcpSynReceived.Description: The average number of sockets in SYN_RCVD state across all the instances of the plan.

TcpSynSent.Description: The average number of sockets in SYN_SENT state across all the instances of the plan.

TcpTimeWait.Description: The average number of sockets in TIME_WAIT state across all the instances of the plan.

AppConnections.Description: The number of bound sockets existing in the sandbox (w3wp.exe and its child processes). A bound socket is created by calling bind()/connect() APIs and remains until said socket is closed with CloseHandle()/closesocket(). For WebApps and FunctionApps.

AverageMemoryWorkingSet.Description: The average amount of memory used by the app, in megabytes (MiB). For WebApps and FunctionApps.

AverageResponseTime.Description: The average time taken for the app to serve requests, in seconds. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

BytesReceived.Description: The amount of incoming bandwidth consumed by the app, in MiB. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

BytesSent.Description: The amount of outgoing bandwidth consumed by the app, in MiB. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

CpuTime.Description: The amount of CPU consumed by the app, in seconds. For more information about this metric. Please see https://aka.ms/website-monitor-cpu-time-vs-cpu-percentage (CPU time vs CPU percentage). For WebApps only.

CurrentAssemblies.Description: The current number of Assemblies loaded across all AppDomains in this application. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

FileSystemUsage.Description: Percentage of filesystem quota consumed by the app. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

FunctionExecutionCount.Description: Function Execution Count. For FunctionApps only.

FunctionExecutionUnits.Description: Function Execution Units. For FunctionApps only.

Gen0Collections.Description: The number of times the generation 0 objects are garbage collected since the start of the app process. Higher generation GCs include all lower generation GCs. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Gen1Collections.Description: The number of times the generation 1 objects are garbage collected since the start of the app process. Higher generation GCs include all lower generation GCs. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Gen2Collections.Description: The number of times the generation 2 objects are garbage collected since the start of the app process. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

PrivateBytes.Description: Private Bytes is the current size, in bytes, of memory that the app process has allocated that can't be shared with other processes. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

BytesPerSecond.Description: Throughput speed of Bytes/second being utilised for a DTA.

DtaCPULoad.Description: CPU consumption by the DTA process.

FileMigrationCount.Description: This provides a running total of how many files have been migrated.

MigratedDataInBytes.Description: This provides a view of the successfully migrated Bytes for a given DTA

NumberOfFailedPaths.Description: A count of which paths have failed to migrate.

BytesMigratedByMigration.Description: Provides a detailed view of a migration's Bytes Transferred

DataTransactionsByMigration.Description: Provides a detailed view of a migration's Data Transactions

DirectoriesCreatedCount.Description: This provides a running view of how many directories have been created as part of a migration.

FileMigrationCount.Description: This provides a running total of how many files have been migrated.

InitialScanDataMigratedInBytes.Description: This provides the view of the total bytes which have been transferred in a new migrator as a result of the initial scan of the On-Premises file system. Any data which is added to the migration after the initial scan migration, is NOT included in this metric.

LiveDataMigratedInBytes.Description: Provides a running total of LiveData which has been changed due to Client activity, since the migration started.

NumberOfExcludedPaths.Description: Provides a running count of the paths which have been excluded from the migration due to Exclusion Rules.

NumberOfFailedPaths.Description: A count of which paths have failed to migrate.

RecurringScanDurationInSeconds.Description: The metric shows the duration in seconds of each scan.

TotalBytesTransferred.Description: This metric covers how many bytes have been transferred (does not reflect how many have successfully migrated, only how much has been transferred).

TotalRecurringScans.Description: This metric shows the count of how many scans have been completed on a recurring migration.

LiveHiveAddedAfterScan.Description: Provides a running total of how many items have been added after the initial scan.

LiveHiveDiscoveredItems.Description: Provides a running total of how many items have been discovered.

LiveHiveInitiallyDiscoveredItems.Description: This provides the view of the total items discovered as a result of the initial scan of the On-Premises file system. Any items that are discovered after the initial scan, are NOT included in this metric.

LiveHiveInitiallyMigratedItems.Description: This provides the view of the total items migrated as a result of the initial scan of the On-Premises file system. Any items that are added after the initial scan, are NOT included in this metric.

LiveHiveMigratedItems.Description: Provides a running total of how many items have been migrated.

BytesPerSecond.Description: Throughput speed of Bytes/second being utilised for a migrator.

DirectoriesCreatedCount.Description: This provides a running view of how many directories have been created as part of a migration.

FileMigrationCount.Description: This provides a running total of how many files have been migrated.

MigratorCPULoad.Description: CPU consumption by the migrator process.

NumberOfFailedPaths.Description: A count of which paths have failed to migrate.

TotalTransactions.Description: This provides a running total of the Data Transactions for which the user could be billed.
